page.title: 02ST ABBS HARBOUR
page.content: ST ABBS HARBOUR. THE FIRST HARBOUR IN ST ABBS WAS BUILT IN 1833 . IT WAS QUITE SMALL AND THERE WAS NO BREAKWATER TO PROTECT THE BOATS FROM THE FIERCE NORTH EAST GALES WHICH BLOW CONSTANTLY ON THIS PART OF THE COAST. IN 1890 , SIR ANDREW USHER , WHO HAD COME TO LIVE IN ST ABBS GAVE MONEY TO THE PEOPLE OF ST ABBS TO BUILD A NEW HARBOUR .THIS WAS DONE BY ENLARGING THE ORIGINAL HARBOUR .BOATS CALLED PUFFERS'USED TO COME AND LAND COAL . THE HARBOUR WAS ALSO USED BY DRIFTERS , WHICH HAD BIG SAILS AND . FISHED FOR HERRING. THERE WERE BOOM GATES AT THE ENTRANCE OF THE HARBOUR AND THESE WERE LOWERED,IN STORMY WEATHER TO PROTECT THE FISHING BOATS.TODAY THE BOOM GATES ARE GONE AND ALL THE BOATS ARE DRIVEN BY DIESEL. THERE ARE ONLY 4 TRAWL BOAT AND 6 INSHORE LOBSTER AND CRAB BOATS.
